==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|しん|けん|yomi=on}}

===Etymology===
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=しんけん}} compound {{m|ltc|眞劍|tr=*tsyin *kjæmH||real sword}}. Compare modern {{etyl|cmn|-}} traditional {{m|cmn|眞劍}} and simplified {{m|cmn|真剑|tr=zhēnjiàn}}.

The original meaning was ''real sword''. Over time, this shifted, and the term is now often used to mean {{m|en|serious}}.

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|yomi=on|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR|しんけん}}

===Adjective===
{{ja-adj|infl=na|しんけん|style=s|kyu=眞劍}}

# [[serious]], [[sincere]], [[intense]], [[honest]]

====Inflection====
{{ja-na|しんけん}}

====Synonyms====
* {{sense|serious, sincere, honest}} {{ja-l|本気|ほんき|honki}}, {{ja-l|真面目|まじめ|majime}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|しんけん|style=s|kyu=眞劍}}

# [[seriousness]]
# a real metal [[sword]], as opposed to a wooden or bamboo sword
